briefdescription.para: Create a new Attribute object.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute properties list. Each property is an object of the AttrProperty class
Temporary attribute object built from user parameters
The device name
The index of the related Attr object in the MultiClassAttribute vector of Attr object

description.para: Only one desctructor is defined for this class

briefdescription.para: The attribute destructor.

description.para: Miscellaneous method returning boolean flag according to attribute state

briefdescription.para: Check if the attribute has an associated writable attribute.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns a boolean set to true if the attribute has a writable attribute associated to it.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if there is an associated writable attribute

briefdescription.para: Check if the attribute is in minimum alarm condition .

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if the attribute is in alarm condition (read value below the min. alarm).

briefdescription.para: Check if the attribute is in maximum alarm condition .

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if the attribute is in alarm condition (read value above the max. alarm).

briefdescription.para: Check if the attribute is in minimum warning condition .

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if the attribute is in warning condition (read value below the min. warning).

briefdescription.para: Check if the attribute is in maximum warning condition .

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if the attribute is in warning condition (read value above the max. warning).

briefdescription.para: Check if the attribute is in RDS alarm condition .

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if the attribute is in RDS condition (Read Different than Set).

briefdescription.para: Check if the attribute has an alarm defined.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns a set of bits. Each alarm type is defined by one bit.

simplesect.para: A bitset. Each bit is set if the coresponding alarm is on

briefdescription.para: Check if the attribute is polled .

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if the attribute is polled.

briefdescription.para: Check if the attribute read value is below/above the alarm level.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if the attribute is in alarm condition.

parameterdescription.para: If no alarm level is defined. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

description.para: These methods allow the external world to get/set DeviceImpl instance data members

briefdescription.para: Get the attribute writable type (RO/WO/RW).

simplesect.para: The attribute write type.

briefdescription.para: Get attribute name.

simplesect.para: The attribute name

briefdescription.para: Get attribute data type.

simplesect.para: The attribute data type

briefdescription.para: Get attribute data format.

simplesect.para: The attribute data format

briefdescription.para: Get name of the associated writable attribute.

simplesect.para: The associated writable attribute name

briefdescription.para: Get index of the associated writable attribute.

simplesect.para: The index in the main attribute vector of the associated writable attribute

briefdescription.para: Set index of the associated writable attribute.

parameterdescription.para: The new index in the main attribute vector of the associated writable attribute

briefdescription.para: Get attribute date.

simplesect.para: The attribute date

briefdescription.para: Set attribute date.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute date

briefdescription.para: Set attribute date.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute date

briefdescription.para: Set attribute date.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute date

briefdescription.para: Get attribute label property.

simplesect.para: The attribute label

briefdescription.para: Get attribute data quality.

simplesect.para: The attribute data quality

briefdescription.para: Set attribute data quality.

parameterdescription.para: The new attribute data quality
Boolean set to true if a change event should be sent

briefdescription.para: Get attribute data size.

simplesect.para: The attribute data size

briefdescription.para: Get attribute data size in x dimension.

simplesect.para: The attribute data size in x dimension. Set to 1 for scalar attribute

briefdescription.para: Get attribute maximum data size in x dimension.

simplesect.para: The attribute maximum data size in x dimension. Set to 1 for scalar attribute

briefdescription.para: Get attribute data size in y dimension.

simplesect.para: The attribute data size in y dimension. Set to 0 for scalar and spectrum attribute

briefdescription.para: Get attribute maximum data size in y dimension.

simplesect.para: The attribute maximum data size in y dimension. Set to 0 for scalar and spectrum attribute

briefdescription.para: Get attribute polling period.

simplesect.para: The attribute polling period in mS. Set to 0 when the attribute is not polled

briefdescription.para: Get all modifiable attribute properties in one call.

detaileddescription.para: This method initializes the members of a MultiAttrProp object with the modifiable attribute properties values

parameterdescription.para: A MultiAttrProp object.

briefdescription.para: Set all modifiable attribute properties in one call.

detaileddescription.para: This method sets the modifiable attribute properties with the values provided as members of MultiAttrProps object

parameterdescription.para: A MultiAttrProp object.

briefdescription.para: Set attribute serialization model.

detaileddescription.para: This method allows the user to choose the attribute serialization model.

parameterdescription.para: The new serialisation model. The serialization model must be one of ATTR_BY_KERNEL, ATTR_BY_USER or ATTR_NO_SYNC

briefdescription.para: Get attribute serialization model.

detaileddescription.para: Get the attribute serialization model

simplesect.para: The attribute serialization model

briefdescription.para: Set attribute user mutex.

detaileddescription.para: This method allows the user to give to the attribute object the pointer to the omni_mutex used to protect its buffer. The mutex has to be locked when passed to this method. The Tango kernel will unlock it when the data will be transferred to the client.

parameterdescription.para: The user mutex pointer

description.para: These methods allows the external world to set attribute object internal value

memberdef.argsstring: (Tango::DevShort *p_data, long x=1, long y=0, bool release=false)
memberdef.name: set_value

briefdescription.para: Set internal attribute value (for Tango::DevShort attribute data type).

detaileddescription.para: This method stores the attribute read value inside the object. This data will be returned to the caller. This method also stores the date when it is called and initialise the attribute quality factor.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute read value
The attribute x length. Default value is 1
The attribute y length. Default value is 0
The release flag. If true, memory pointed to by p_data will be freed after being send to the client. Default value is false.
If the attribute data type is not coherent. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

memberdef.argsstring: (Tango::DevShort *p_data, time_t t, Tango::AttrQuality qual, long x=1, long y=0, bool release=false)
memberdef.name: set_value_date_quality

briefdescription.para: Set internal attribute value, date and quality factor (for Tango::DevShort attribute data type).

detaileddescription.para: This method stores the attribute read value, the date and the attribute quality factor inside the object. This data will be returned to the caller.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute read value
The date
The attribute quality factor
The attribute x length. Default value is 1
The attribute y length. Default value is 0
The release flag. If true, memory pointed to by p_data will be freed after being send to the client. Default value is false.
If the attribute data type is not coherent. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

memberdef.argsstring: (Tango::DevShort *p_data, struct timeval &t, Tango::AttrQuality qual, long x=1, long y=0, bool release=false)
memberdef.name: set_value_date_quality

briefdescription.para: Set internal attribute value, date and quality factor (for Tango::DevShort attribute data type).

detaileddescription.para: This method stores the attribute read value, the date and the attribute quality factor inside the object. This data will be returned to the caller.
Please note that for Win32 user, the same method is defined using a "_timeb" structure instead of a "timeval" structure to set date.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute read value
The date
The attribute quality factor
The attribute x length. Default value is 1
The attribute y length. Default value is 0
The release flag. If true, memory pointed to by p_data will be freed after being send to the client. Default value is false.
If the attribute data type is not coherent. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

memberdef.name: set_value_date_quality

briefdescription.para: Set internal attribute value, date and quality factor (for Tango::DevUChar attribute data type).

detaileddescription.para: This method stores the attribute read value, the date and the attribute quality factor inside the object. This data will be returned to the caller.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute read value
The date
The attribute quality factor
The attribute x length. Default value is 1
The attribute y length. Default value is 0
The release flag. If true, memory pointed to by p_data will be freed after being send to the client. Default value is false.
If the attribute data type is not coherent. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

memberdef.argsstring: (Tango::DevUChar *p_data, struct timeval &t, Tango::AttrQuality qual, long x=1, long y=0, bool release=false)
memberdef.name: set_value_date_quality

briefdescription.para: Set internal attribute value, date and quality factor (for Tango::DevUChar attribute data type).

detaileddescription.para: This method stores the attribute read value, the date and the attribute quality factor inside the object. This data will be returned to the caller.
Please note that for Win32 user, the same method is defined using a "_timeb" structure instead of a "timeval" structure to set date.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute read value
The date
The attribute quality factor
The attribute x length. Default value is 1
The attribute y length. Default value is 0
The release flag. If true, memory pointed to by p_data will be freed after being send to the client. Default value is false.
If the attribute data type is not coherent. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

Please note that for Win32 user, the same method is defined using a "_timeb" structure instead of a "timeval" structure to set date.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute format string
The attribute raw data
Size of the attribute raw data part
The date
The attribute quality factor
The release flag. If true, memory pointed to by p_data will be freed after being send to the client. Default value is false.
If the attribute data type is not coherent. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Fire a change event for the attribute value.

detaileddescription.para: The event is pushed to the notification daemon. The attibute data must be set with one of the Attribute::set_value or Attribute::setvalue_date_quality methods before fireing the event. The event is triggered with or without the change event criteria depending on the configuration choosen with set_change_event(). ATTENTION: The couple set_value() and fire_change_event() needs to be protected against concurrent accesses to the same attribute. Such an access might happen during a synchronous read or by a reading from the polling thread. Inside all methods reading or writing commands and attributes this protection is automatically done by the Tango serialisation monitor. When fireing change events in your own code, you should use the push_change_event methods of the DeviceImpl class or protect your code with the Tango::AutoTangoMonitor on your device. Example:
{ Tango::AutoTangoMonitor synch(this); att_temp_seq.set_value (temp_seq, 100); att_temp_seq.fire_archive_event (); }

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a DevFailed exception to be thrown as archive event.

briefdescription.para: Set a flag to indicate that the server fires change events manually, without the polling to be started for the attribute.

detaileddescription.para: If the detect parameter is set to true, the criteria specified for the change event are verified and the event is only pushed if they are fulfilled. If detect is set to false the event is fired without any value checking!

parameterdescription.para: True when the server fires change events manually.
Triggers the verification of the change event properties when set to true.

briefdescription.para: Check if the change event is fired manually (without polling) for this attribute.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if a manual fire change event is implemented.

briefdescription.para: Check if the change event criteria should be checked when firing the event manually.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if a change event criteria will be checked.

briefdescription.para: Fire an archive event for the attribute value.

detaileddescription.para: The event is pushed to the notification daemon. The attibute data must be set with one of the Attribute::set_value or Attribute::setvalue_date_quality methods before fireing the event. The event is triggered with or without the archive event criteria depending on the configuration choosen with set_archive_event(). ATTENTION: The couple set_value() and fire_archive_event() needs to be protected against concurrent accesses to the same attribute. Such an access might happen during a synchronous read or by a reading from the polling thread. Inside all methods reading or writing commands and attributes this protection is automatically done by the Tango serialisation monitor. When fireing archive events in your own code, you should use the push_archive_event methods of the DeviceImpl class or protect your code with the Tango::AutoTangoMonitor on your device. Example:
{ Tango::AutoTangoMonitor synch(this); att_temp_seq.set_value (temp_seq, 100); att_temp_seq.fire_archive_event (); }

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a DevFailed exception to be thrown as archive event.

briefdescription.para: Set a flag to indicate that the server fires archive events manually, without the polling to be started for the attribute If the detect parameter is set to true, the criteria specified for the archive event are verified and the event is only pushed if they are fulfilled.

detaileddescription.para: If detect is set to false the event is fired without any value checking!

parameterdescription.para: True when the server fires archive events manually.
Triggers the verification of the archive event properties when set to true.

briefdescription.para: Check if the archive event is fired manually for this attribute.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if a manual fire archive event is implemented.

briefdescription.para: Check if the archive event criteria should be checked when firing the event manually.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if a archive event criteria will be checked.

briefdescription.para: Set a flag to indicate that the server fires data ready events.

parameterdescription.para: True when the server fires change events manually.

briefdescription.para: Check if the data ready event is fired for this attribute.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if a fire data ready event is implemented.

briefdescription.para: Fire a user event for the attribute value.

detaileddescription.para: The event is pushed to the notification daemon. The attibute data must be set with one of the Attribute::set_value or Attribute::setvalue_date_quality methods before fireing the event. ATTENTION: The couple set_value() and fire_event() needs to be protected against concurrent accesses to the same attribute. Such an access might happen during a synchronous read or by a reading from the polling thread. Inside all methods reading or writing commands and attributes this protection is automatically done by the Tango serialisation monitor. When fireing archive events in your own code, you should use the push_event methods of the DeviceImpl class or protect your code with the Tango::AutoTangoMonitor on your device. Example:
{ Tango::AutoTangoMonitor synch(this); att_temp_seq.set_value (temp_seq, 100); att_temp_seq.fire_event (); }

parameterdescription.para: The filterable fields name
The filterable fields value (as double)
A pointer to a DevFailed exception to be thrown as archive event.

briefdescription.para: Remove the attribute configuration from the database.

detaileddescription.para: This method can be used to clean-up all the configuration of an attribute to come back to its default values or the remove all configuration of a dynamic attribute before deleting it.
The method removes all configured attribute properties and removes the attribute from the list of polled attributes.

parameterdescription.para: In case of database access problems. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

sectiondef.header: Set/Get attribute ranges (min_alarm, min_warning, max_warning, max_alarm) methods.

description.para: These methods allow the external world to set attribute object min_alarm, min_warning, max_warning and max_alarm values

briefdescription.para: Set attribute minimum alarm.

detaileddescription.para: This method sets the attribute minimum alarm.

parameterdescription.para: The new attribute minimum alarm value
If the attribute data type is not coherent. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Get attribute minimum alarm or throw an exception if the attribute does not have the minimum alarm.

parameterdescription.para: Reference to a variable which value will be set to the attribute's minimum alarm

briefdescription.para: Set attribute maximum alarm.

detaileddescription.para: This method sets the attribute maximum alarm.

parameterdescription.para: The new attribute maximum alarm value
If the attribute data type is not coherent. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Get attribute maximum alarm or throw an exception if the attribute does not have the maximum alarm set.

parameterdescription.para: Reference to a variable which value will be set to the attribute's maximum alarm

briefdescription.para: Set attribute minimum warning.

detaileddescription.para: This method sets the attribute minimum warning.

parameterdescription.para: The new attribute minimum warning value
If the attribute data type is not coherent. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Get attribute minimum warning or throw an exception if the attribute does not have the minimum warning set.

parameterdescription.para: Reference to a variable which value will be set to the attribute's minimum warning

briefdescription.para: Set attribute maximum warning.

detaileddescription.para: This method sets the attribute maximum warning.

parameterdescription.para: The new attribute maximum warning value
If the attribute data type is not coherent. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Get attribute maximum warning or throw an exception if the attribute does not have the maximum warning set.

parameterdescription.para: Reference to a variable which value will be set to the attribute's maximum warning

briefdescription.para: A flag set to true if the attribute value has been updated.
The date when attribute was read.
Flag set to true if the date must be set.
The attribute quality factor.
The attribute name.
The attribute writable flag.
The attribute data type.

detaileddescription.para: Forteen types are suported. They are Tango::DevShort, Tango::DevUShort, Tango::DevLong, Tango::DevULong, Tango::DevLong64, Tango::DevULong64, Tango::DevDouble, Tango::DevString, , Tango::DevUChar, Tango::DevFloat, Tango::DevBoolean, Tango::DevState, Tango::DevEncoded and Tango::DevEnum

briefdescription.para: The attribute data format.

detaileddescription.para: Three data formats are supported. They are SCALAR, SPECTRUM and IMAGE

briefdescription.para: The attribute maximum x dimension.

detaileddescription.para: It is needed for SPECTRUM or IMAGE data format

briefdescription.para: The attribute maximum y dimension.

detaileddescription.para: It is necessary only for IMAGE data format

briefdescription.para: The attribute label.
The attribute description.
The attribute unit.
The attribute standard unit.
The attribute display unit.
The attribute format.

detaileddescription.para: This string specifies how an attribute value must be printed

briefdescription.para: The name of the associated writable attribute.
The attribute minimum alarm level.
The attribute maximun alarm level.
The attribute minimum value.
The attribute maximum value.
The attribute minimun warning.
The attribute maximum warning.
The attribute delta value RDS alarm.
The attribute delta time RDS alarm.
Index in the main attribute vector of the associated writable attribute (if any)
The attribute minimum alarm in binary format.
The attribute maximum alarm in binary format.
The attribute minimum warning in binary format.
The attribute maximum warning in binary format.
The attribute minimum value in binary format.
The attribute maximum value in binary format.
The attribute value.
The attribute data size.
Flag set to true if a minimum value is defined.
Flag set to true if a maximum alarm is defined.
Authorized delta between the last written value and the actual read.

detaileddescription.para: Used if the attribute has an alarm on Read Different Than Set (RDS)

briefdescription.para: Delta time after which the read value must be checked again the last written value if the attribute has an alarm on Read Different Than Set (RDS)
Enumeration labels when the attribute data type is DevEnum.
